meanings.definition: A small sensor used to detect and measure physical or chemical properties.
meanings.sent1: The microsensor detected the temperature in the room.
meanings.sent2: I installed a microsensor to monitor the air quality in my house.
meanings.sent3: The microsensor and the thermometer had a race to see who could measure the temperature faster.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition was like a microsensor, always picking up on subtle changes in the environment.
meanings.sent5: The microsensor hummed softly as it analyzed the chemical composition of the liquid.

meanings.definition: A device that converts a physical quantity into an electrical signal.
meanings.sent1: The microsensor transformed the pressure into an electrical signal.
meanings.sent2: The microsensor in the camera converted light into digital information.
meanings.sent3: The microsensor and the wire had a conversation about converting physical quantities into electrical signals.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a microsensor, translating emotions into clear signals.
meanings.sent5: The microsensor crackled with energy as it converted motion into electrical impulses.
